snippet: The announcement followed weeks of mounting doubt about whether Germany has the capacity to handle almost 800,000 refugees who have arrived this year.
abstract: German Interior Ministry announces it is considering reinstating controls on number of Syrian refugees arriving in country and will make rules regarding refugees bringing in their families more strict.
lead_paragraph: The announcement followed weeks of mounting doubt about whether Germany has the capacity to handle almost 800,000 refugees who have arrived this year.

headline.main: Germany Considers Tightening the Rules for Syrian Refugees
headline.print_headline: Berlin Weighs Tighter Rules for Refugees
